notableFeatures: Scar on left cheek from a lab accident
Always wears a silver pendant of a DNA helix

tools: High-tech prosthetic arm with integrated tools

notableEvents: Graduated top of her class from Stanford School of Medicine at age 21
Lost her right arm in a lab explosion at age 28, replaced it with a high-tech prosthetic
Invented a revolutionary gene therapy to cure a deadly disease at age 32
Became the youngest recipient of the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine at age 33
goals: To find a cure for aging
To create a more efficient gene-editing technology
To pioneer the integration of AI with human biology
challenges: Overcoming the trauma of her lab accident
Fighting against the ethical criticisms of her work
